response: "I just can't keep up with everyone's expectations anymore. It's like I'm drowning in this constant pressure to be perfect."
"I feel like I'm losing touch with reality. The more I try to fit into society's idea of perfection, the more I feel like I'm losing myself."
"Why is it that no matter what I do, it's never enough? I feel like I'm going crazy trying to meet these impossible standards."
"I'm starting to question if there's even such a thing as 'perfect.' It feels like an unattainable goal that only exists to make me feel inadequate."
"The more I compare myself to others, the more I lose sight of who I am. It's like I'm living in this distorted reality where everyone else has it all figured out."
"I'm exhausted from trying to be flawless. It's like there's this constant voice in my head telling me I'm not good enough, and it's driving me crazy."
"I can't help but wonder if society's obsession with perfection is just an illusion. I'm starting to question if it's worth sacrificing my mental well-being for."
"Why do I feel so trapped in this never-ending cycle of trying to be perfect? It's like I'm on a rollercoaster that I can't get off."
"I'm beginning to realize that my worth shouldn't be determined by society's standards. But breaking free from that mindset feels impossible sometimes."
"I just wish I could escape from all these expectations and just be myself. It's like I'm suffocating in this pressure to conform."
